Core Services: IAM S3

IAM << Back Best practices: Lock away your AWS Account Root Access Keys. Create individual IAM Users. Configure strong pasword policy for your users. Rotate credentials regularly. Remove unnecessary credentials. Enable Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) for priviliged users. Use Groups to assign permissions to IAM Users. Use AWS Defined Policies to assign permissions whenever possible. Use Policy Conditions for Extra security.
